We are focused on assisting national and international clients within the Creative, New Media and Entertainment industries, including but not limited to TV, Film, Music, Video Games, Themed Entertainment, Resorts, Casinos, Apparel, Hospitality, Marketing, Advertising, Talent Agencies, Start-up Companies, World-Wide Sporting Events, just to name a few.

data.text: VP, Culture and People in the Orlando area, we are looking for you. Please see below an overview of responsibilities. Responsibilities: The VP of People and Culture will be responsible for overseeing the development and implementation of a comprehensive internal talent management program that attracts, develops, motivates, and retains a high-performing and diverse workforce. In this role, you will provide leadership and strategic direction for all aspects of HR, including employee relations, talent acquisition, compensation and benefits, training and development, performance management, and organizational development and culture. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: · Develop and implement a comprehensive people and culture strategy that supports the organization's mission, values, and business objectives. · Lead recruitment efforts to attract top talent, develop innovative strategies for employee retention, and oversee onboarding processes to ensure a smooth transition for new hires. · Design and implement programs for professional development, career advancement, and succession planning to support employee growth and enhance organizational capabilities. · Oversee compensation and benefits programs to ensure competitive and equitable pay and benefits. · Develop initiatives to enhance employee morale, motivation, and satisfaction, including employee recognition programs, wellness initiatives, and opportunities for social connection and collaboration. · Lead change management efforts to support organizational growth, transformation, and adaptation to evolving market conditions and business priorities. This includes development initiatives to enhance the effectiveness of the organization. · Oversee day-to-day HR operations, including compensation and benefits administration, HRIS management, policy development, and compliance with employment laws and regulations. Qualifications: · Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Organizational Psychology, or a related field; Master's degree preferred. · 10+ years of progressive experience in human resources, with at least 5 years in a leadership role. · Experience with international markets to include recruitment, compensation, and benefit strategies. This is a Hybrid, FT role based in the Orlando area. For more information, please send resumes to recruiter1@11thr.com
